reviews.sentence: Disappointing. When we checked in the man at reception asked for a my i d and card standard check in he then proceeded to tell me there was going to be a bond of 150 which I was unaware of when I booked. He also did not tell me when the bond would be refunded or why they were taking it. A week later I received the refund for the bond. When we arrived at our level all we could smell was Indian food not sure if all levels had this problem but it was very unsettling. Room layout was nice and has a decent sized bathroom. We booked a queen bed and ended up with 2 singles it did not bother us enough to call reception as it was NYE and we were only staying one night. Beds were extremely uncomfortable my friend ended up with knots all in her back the next morning. Would only really recommend as a last minute option which it was for us and if you are not going to be in the room much. Stayed in 0413 view was of the carpark.

Facilities especially bathroom need of upgrade no fan in toilet tiles old shower in bath weight scales 30 years old carpet needs upgrade stuffy no windows to open windows need cleaning. Staff helpful and pleasant kitchen good in room breakfast OK location good staff kitchen in room location Good for open tennis walk on yara eating places nearby trams nearby Bathroom fan in toilet weight scales carpet stuffy.
Rooms are a little run down but still OK. Not bad gym has 2 treadmills a bike and some free weight dumbbells pluss some other machines Pool and sauna are good.

Bed rock hard. The size of room was satisfactory and the bathroom was tired but clean. The bed however was extremely hard. I like the bed to be firm but this was as if I was sleeping on a wooden plank. I wonk up the next morning with excruciating back pain and neck pain from the flat pillows. I asked at reception to switch rooms and they told me that all beds were the same so there would be no point switching. After several attempts I got reception to have a doner put in my room that maybe I could lie on like a mattress topper. When I returned from work that evening the doner provided was 2 blankets and a white sheet. The thought of sleeping on that bed again was too much and I checked out early nobody asked why or if they could do anything to help. I checked into a hotel down the road where the bed was much more comfortable and the staff upgraded me to a suite when I explained what had happened here. Avoid this hotel at all costs unles you like to sleep on the floor and like unhelpful staff.

A mixed experience. The property was very comfortable well appointed and clean. The staff were friendly and very competent. Unfortunately a VERY loud noise commenced in my room at 1 am waking me from sleep. I had to move rooms and did not get back to sleep till after 3 am. I had driven to Melbourne on the Sunday night specifically so I would be fresh for a conference the next day but instead wound up very tired because of the disruption. A bit of a waste of money in the end. Also the lids on the hot food containers at the strongbreakfaststrong were so heavy I could hardly lift them.

Only stay if a significant discount is offered. Good location. Guest smoking in rooms and staff unwilling to take action. Noise from the downstairs night club until early in the morning. All the drunks hung around near the hotel. Unfriendly and aggressive staff who accused us of lying about the smoke. The gym facilities were terrible and things did n’t work. The room was dusty on arrival and they do not give spare pillows towels or blankets.

Good location comfortable bed. Very disappointing hotel more of a back packer hotel location Look at better cleaning products that do not overpower the whole reception area. Cleaning trolleys in reception the whole time we were there. Service.

We chose this hotel after seeing it was well priced and in an area of Melbourne we had not stayed before. We definitely regret not paying a little bit extra to stay elsewhere in Melbourne. Mould in the bathroom along the tiles and glass dated decor rude staff at reception and curtains that do not close due to being broken does not quite allow for a sleep in. The bedding was just a fleece blanket between a few sheets and did not even cover the length of the bed leaving our feet cold until we had to remake the bed with an extra blanket. No ventilation system whatsoever in the bathroom or room and windows were unable to open. We had to leave the aircon on the whole trip to try and circulate some fresh air. With no bathroom ventilation we understand why there is mould. For 20 extra a night we could have stayed somewhere with better amenities more attentive staff and unlimited free wifi they charged up to 18 a day. do not let the good reviews fool you this place really was horrible.
For a studio apartment the room was a generous size. TV did not work properly. Tea and coffee facility very sparse.

Great stay. The staff in this hotel are all about customer service. All that I dealt with were friendly willing to help thoughtful and informative. It was refreshing. The room was great. The location is good too with trams close by and the shopping mall within walking distance. The only thing I would say is that pram access is not great but again the staff are more than happy to help lift. I would definitely stay again.

Incredibly surprised. I ’ve got ta day. my experience with Oaks on Market was incredible. On arrival we were greeted by really friendly staff who were really informative of the area and were an absolute pleasure to deal with. I’ve had issues with 5 star hotels where you arrive and they get your booking wrong. This was not the case here. The staff knew exactly what I had booked and when we enquired about additional services the staff knew exactly what we were talking about knew the insides and outs of the services and were able to clearly explain and answer any questions. The foyer was clean and smelt great. Made it very inviting. The room was clean and tidy. Bed was comfortable and the complimentary Foxtel was sweet. We did n’t use room service so we ca n’t comment on that. Throightout our stay the staff were very attentive and helpful. Would highly recommend Oaks on Market and would stay there again.
Clean and Spacious. Room was very clean and spacious. Reception staff were lovely. Only downfall due to construction work not hotel fault but was noisy in the morning.

Excellent choice at very reasonable prices. Returning again to this great value hotel was no mistake. This facility offers all most would wish for in a location that is central to many of Melbourne ’s great attractions. You will not go wrong staying here.
great location clean and enjoyable hotel. wonderful hotel. Pool sauna and gym one of the best. Lovely clean heated pool. In house restaurant really good. Pancake machine a hit with the family.
Great value considering facilities and location in comparison with other nearby hotels. Asked for a replacement ironing board cover and told it would happen but did not. This was the only negative.

Great Stay. Pleasant experience at the reception. Loved the chance to over look the Yara river. Clean and tidy room. Pool and spa great to relax. Annoyed that I had to keep writing before this review would be accepted.
Exceptional. Beautiful hotel comfy bed good facilities great location in the city.

Good value and tidy and comfy rooms. Had a lovely stay with my parents in a 2 bedroom apartment and can not fault one thing restaurant was great and pool and gym facility was top notch. Would stay again for sure next time we are back in Melb.

2 weeks stay in December. Room and bathroom are decent quality bed is good. Shower can be a little cumbersome to adjust but once figured out it is comfortable. Bar is very good with pretty good service and food available at late hours. Reception personnel are friendly. The ladies at the breakfast area are extremely nice and make great coffee.

Brilliant and great value for money. Such lovely staff the amenities are far beyond what you ’d expect and the ability to cook and dine in room with ease is a real plus. The parking was cheap the staff met us outside as we were unsure where to park. The location was A1.
